SegmentId.description: The unique identifier for the segment.

Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the segment.

Recency.description: Specifies how recently segment members were active.

Behavior.description: Specifies behavior-based criteria for the segment, such as how recently users have used your app.

Latitude.description: The latitude coordinate of the location.

Longitude.description: The longitude coordinate of the location.

Coordinates.description: Specifies the GPS coordinates of a location.

AppVersion.description: The app version criteria for the segment.

Channel.description: The channel criteria for the segment.

DeviceType.description: The device type criteria for the segment.

Make.description: The device make criteria for the segment.

Model.description: The device model criteria for the segment.

Platform.description: The device platform criteria for the segment.

Demographic.description: Specifies demographic-based criteria, such as device platform, for the segment.

Coordinates.description: The GPS coordinates to measure distance from.

RangeInKilometers.description: The range, in kilometers, from the GPS coordinates.

GPSPoint.description: Specifies the GPS coordinates of the endpoint location.

Dimensions.description: An array that defines the dimensions to include or exclude from the segment.

SourceSegments.description:
The base segment to build the segment on. A base segment, also called a *source segment* , defines the initial population of endpoints for a segment. When you add dimensions to the segment, Amazon Pinpoint filters the base segment by using the dimensions that you specify.

You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported segment. If you specify an imported segment, the segment size estimate that displays on the Amazon Pinpoint console indicates the size of the imported segment without any filters applied to it.

SourceType.description: Specifies how to handle multiple base segments for the segment. For example, if you specify three base segments for the segment, whether the resulting segment is based on all, any, or none of the base segments.

Type.description: Specifies how to handle multiple dimensions for the segment. For example, if you specify three dimensions for the segment, whether the resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of the dimensions.

Groups.description: An array that defines the set of segment criteria to evaluate when handling segment groups for the segment.

Country.description: The country or region code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the segment.

GPSPoint.description: The GPS point dimension for the segment.

Location.description: Specifies location-based criteria, such as region or GPS coordinates, for the segment.

Duration.description:
The duration to use when determining which users have been active or inactive with your app.

Possible values: `HR_24` | `DAY_7` | `DAY_14` | `DAY_30` .

RecencyType.description: The type of recency dimension to use for the segment. Valid values are: `ACTIVE` and `INACTIVE` . If the value is `ACTIVE` , the segment includes users who have used your app within the specified duration are included in the segment. If the value is `INACTIVE` , the segment includes users who haven't used your app within the specified duration are included in the segment.

Recency.description: Specifies how recently segment members were active.

Attributes.description: One or more custom attributes to use as criteria for the segment. For more information see [AttributeDimension](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/pinpoint/latest/apireference/apps-application-id-segments.html#apps-application-id-segments-model-attributedimension)

Behavior.description: The behavior-based criteria, such as how recently users have used your app, for the segment.

Demographic.description: The demographic-based criteria, such as device platform, for the segment.

Location.description: The location-based criteria, such as region or GPS coordinates, for the segment.

Metrics.description: One or more custom metrics to use as criteria for the segment.

UserAttributes.description: One or more custom user attributes to use as criteria for the segment.

SegmentDimensions.description: Specifies the dimension settings for a segment.

Groups.description: Specifies the set of segment criteria to evaluate when handling segment groups for the segment.

Include.description: Specifies how to handle multiple segment groups for the segment. For example, if the segment includes three segment groups, whether the resulting segment includes endpoints that match all, any, or none of the segment groups.

SegmentGroups.description: Specifies the set of segment criteria to evaluate when handling segment groups for the segment.

DimensionType.description: The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are: `INCLUSIVE` , endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment; and, `EXCLUSIVE` , endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the segment.

Values.description: The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the value of the `DimensionType` property, endpoints are included or excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.

SetDimension.description: Specifies the dimension type and values for a segment dimension.

Id.description: The unique identifier for the source segment.

Version.description: The version number of the source segment.

SourceSegments.description:
Specifies the base segment to build the segment on. A base segment, also called a *source segment* , defines the initial population of endpoints for a segment. When you add dimensions to the segment, Amazon Pinpoint filters the base segment by using the dimensions that you specify.

You can specify more than one dimensional segment or only one imported segment. If you specify an imported segment, the segment size estimate that displays on the Amazon Pinpoint console indicates the size of the imported segment without any filters applied to it.

description: Updates the configuration, dimension, and other settings for an existing segment.

ApplicationId.description: The unique identifier for the Amazon Pinpoint application that the segment is associated with.

Dimensions.description: An array that defines the dimensions for the segment.

Name.description:
The name of the segment.

> A segment must have a name otherwise it will not appear in the Amazon Pinpoint console.

SegmentGroups.description: The segment group to use and the dimensions to apply to the group's base segments in order to build the segment. A segment group can consist of zero or more base segments. Your request can include only one segment group.

Tags.description:
An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

For more information, see [Tag](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-resource-tags.html) .
